today all the central banks the major

and they announced they were going to
provide as many dollars as the European
banks needed to stay into business and

Bahrain has been largely off-limits to

beirut bureau chief anthony shadid

Bahrain is seen as a cornerstone of the
counter-revolution that wasn't the case
back in February when hundreds even
thousands of protestors took it a
landmark roundabout in the island known
as pulse square the crackdown that
ensued disproportionately targeted
Shiites and some activists have compared
to crack down to apartheid style
repression 1400 people were arrested
most of the machines torture was rife

one of the most lasting legacies of the

sectarian tension the two community
Sunni and Shiite emmaireland never lived

blows it accelerated and the state

now
